gurmukhi: ਤਪੈ ਖੱਗ ਪਾਨੰ ॥ ਮਹਾਂ ਲੋਕ ਦਾਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Tapai Khagg Paanan|| Mahaan Lok Daanan||
translation: The sword shines in His hand and He is a Great Donor for the people.
I salute the Supreme KAL, who is unique in the present and shall be unique in future. 40.

gurmukhi: ਮਧੋ ਮਾਨ ਮੁੰਡੰ ॥ ਸੁਭੰ ਰੁੰਡ ਝੁੰਡੰ ॥
transliteration: Madho Maan Mounndan|| Soubhan Round Jhoundan||
translation: He is the effacer of the pride of the demon Madhu and the destroyer of the demon Sumbh.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੰ ਸੇਤ ਛੱਤ੍ਰੰ ॥ ਲਸੰ ਹਾਥ ਅੱਤ੍ਰੰ ॥੪੧॥
transliteration: Siran Set Chhatran|| Lasan Haath Attran||41||
translation: He hath white canopy over His head and the weapons glisten in His hands.41.
Hearing His loud voice, the great monarchs are frightened.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਸਾ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਰਾਜੰ ॥ ਸ੍ਰਣੇ ਦੋਖ ਭਾਜੰ ॥੪੨॥
transliteration: Disaa Bastra Raajan|| Soune Dokh Bhaajan||42||
translation: He wears elegantly the garments of directions and listening to His voice, the sorrows run away. 42.
Hearing His call, the infinite happiness is attained.
He is Shyam in the form of clouds and appears beautiful and impressive.43.

gurmukhi: ਚਤੁਰ ਬਾਹੁ ਚਾਰੰ ॥ ਕਰੀਟੰ ਸੁ ਧਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Chatur Baab(u) Chaaran|| Katootan Su Dhaaran||
translation: He hath four beautiful arms and is wearing crown on the head.

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾ ਸੰਖ ਚੱਕ੍ਰੰ ॥ ਦਿਪੈ ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਬੱਕ੍ਰੰ ॥੪੪॥
transliteration: Gadaa Sankh Chakkran|| Dipai Kroor Bakkran||44||
translation: The mace, conch and disc glisten and seem frightful and resplendent. 44.

gurmukhi: ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਰਾਜਿਅੰ ॥ ਨਿਹਾਰ ਕਾਮੁ ਲਾਜਿਅੰ ॥
transliteration: Anoop Roop Raajian|| Nihaar Kaam(u) Laajian||
translation: The unique beauty appears graceful and on seeing it the Cupid seems ashamed.

gurmukhi: ਅਲੋਕ ਲੋਕ ਸੋਭਿਅੰ ॥ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਲੋਕ ਲੋਭਿਅੰ ॥੪੫॥
transliteration: Alok Lok Sobhian|| Bilok Lok Lobhian||45||
translation: In the worlds it has supernatural radiance, seeting whichall the people are fascinated. 45.

gurmukhi: ਚਮੱਕ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਸੀਸਿਯੰ ॥ ਰਹਿਓ ਲਜਾੲਿ ੲੀਸਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Chamakk Channdra Soosiyan|| Rahio Laj Oosayan||
translation: The moon is bearning on his head, seeing which the god Shiva feels shy.
